managed to breach the mummies' resting space. reports the New York Daily News, but many made it no further than the gift shop. Nine looters headed past the knockoffs to find the true treasure. They were looking for gold, Egypt's antiquities minister Zahi Hawass told TIME, and they weren't afraid to destroy what was in their path in order to find it. They smashed 13 display cases, including one in the King Tut exhibit.
